name: The Coward's Exit
description: Player runs with the King when a simple capture or block exists.
coachMessage: Why do you run? You have a sword—use it!

name: The Over-Protector
description: Player uses a very valuable piece to block a check when a pawn or minor piece can do the job.
coachMessage: Do not use a golden shield to stop a wooden arrow.

name: The Endless Chase
description: Player gives repeated, unnecessary checks instead of finishing with a simple checkmate.
coachMessage: Checks alone do not kill. When you can mate, you must end the game.

name: The Suffocator
description: Player stalemates the opponent when a clean checkmate is available.
coachMessage: You forgot to leave him one last breath before you strike. Now nobody wins.

name: The Missed Fork
description: Player attacks only one piece when they could attack two simultaneously.
coachMessage: You attacked only one piece when you could attack two. Always look for the move that hurts in two places.

name: The Greedy Grab
description: Player captures material immediately instead of setting up a bigger tactical blow.
coachMessage: You grabbed material now and missed the move that would win even more. Do not eat the first pawn if there is a fork available.

name: The Missed Pin
description: Player makes a normal developing move instead of pinning an enemy piece.
coachMessage: You played a normal move and ignored the chance to freeze his piece in place. When you can pin, you must at least consider it.

name: The Moving Prisoner
description: Player moves a pinned piece, exposing their King or losing material.
coachMessage: That piece is nailed to the King. If it moves, disaster follows.

name: The Released Pressure
description: Player has an opponent's piece pinned but plays a passive move instead of exploiting it.
coachMessage: You had him tied up, and then you let him breathe again. When a piece is pinned, increase the pressure, do not relax.

name: The Missed Skewer
description: Player gives check without lining up a valuable piece behind the King.
coachMessage: You gave a check, but you did not aim through him. In a skewer, you must line up the King and the treasure behind him.

name: Outside the Square
description: Player's King stayed outside the pawn's square and cannot catch it.
coachMessage: Too slow! You stayed outside the pawn's box. You cannot catch him now.

name: The Slow King
description: Player walks with the King when they should be racing with their own pawn.
coachMessage: In pawn races, every tempo counts. If you walk while he runs, you lose.

name: The Wrong Opposition
description: Player steps to the side instead of taking direct opposition.
coachMessage: This is not a dance—it is a fight for the central square. Step in front, not to the side.

name: Gave Up Opposition
description: Player had the opposition and lost it with a careless King move.
coachMessage: You had the advantage and gave it back with one careless King move.

name: The Premature Push
description: Player pushes the pawn before the King is properly positioned to support it.
coachMessage: Do not send the pawn forward without his King. Alone, he is just a target.

name: The Polite King
description: Player steps aside instead of shouldering the enemy King away from the battle.
coachMessage: Do not step aside like a gentleman. Use your shoulders to push his King away from the battle.
